question: 五日
sourceMnemonic: <vocabulary>Day five</vocabulary> or the <vocabulary>fifth day</vocabulary>. No matter how you look at this word, it makes a lot of sense.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Words that count days use an exceptional reading. Even though this is a jukugo word, it uses kun'yomi readings for both the kanji. Think about this word this way:

On the <vocabulary>fifth day</vocabulary> I have to <reading>eat</reading> (<ja>いつ</ja>) five <reading>ca</reading>rs (<ja>か</ja>). Now imagine yourself eating five cars. How did you manage to get past the first one? I'm impressed.
